questions: How do some micro-organisms clean up the environment ?
answers: Some micro-organisms decompose the organic waste and dead plants and animals into simple substance and clean up the environment.

questions: What is the basis of the use of yeast in the baking industry ?
answers: Yeast reproduces rapidly and produces carbon dioxide during respiration. Bubbles of gas fill the dough and increase its volume. This is the basis of the use of yeast in baking industry.
Microbial diseases that can spread from an infected person to a healthy person through air, water food or physical contact, are called communicable diseases. e.g. cholera, common cold etc.

questions: What are general preventive measures to protect ourselves from cholera ?
answers: To prevent ourselves from cholera we should maintain personal hygiene and good sanitary habits.

questions: How are micro-organisms useful for commercial productions ?
answers: Micro-organisms are commercially used for the large scale production of alcohol, wine and acetic acid. Yeast is commonly used for commercial production of wine and alcohol.

questions: Who discovered the first antibiotic ? Name any two antibiotics.
answers: Alexander Fleming discovered first antibiotic penicillin. Two other common antibiotics are streptomycin and tetracycline.

questions: Why are vaccines so important for children ?
answers: By introducing vaccine in body, the body fights and kills the bacteria by producing suitable antibodies. The antibodies remain in the body and the child is protected from the disease causing microbes.
